title: Sunday Boredom Busters
text:
October 24,   
It's Kids Day at the Sioux Falls Jaycees Haunted House. Kids 12 and under can go on a less-scary tour from 2-4 p.m. The haunted house is located in   
Celebrate Halloween with the animals at the Great Plains Zoo. ZooBoo features   Hours are from 3:30 to 7 p.m. The   
Star Performance Complex is hosting a Grand Opening-Open House and Gym Playtime. Check out their cheer, dance and gymnastics programs from 3-6 p.m. You also have a chance to win a free birthday party. Star Performance is located at 725 Brian, in Tea, SD. 
Hundreds of vendors are selling their arts and crafts at the Autumn Festival at the Sioux Falls Convention Center. The hours are from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Admission is $8 for adults, $7 for seniors, free for kids 10 and under. 
The Sioux Empire Community Theatre presents The Musical Adventures of Flat Stanley. The performance is at 2 p.m. at the Orpheum Theater in downtown Sioux Falls. Tickets are $13. 
Hundreds of pooches are unleashing their skills at the Sioux Empire Kennel Club Conformation   Admission is free. 
A Veterans Memorial will be dedicated during a 2 p.m. ceremony at Terrace Park in Springfield, SD. A reception will follow at the Springfield Community Center. The Springfield Historical Museum and College Museum will be also be open today. 
First Presbyterian Church in Huron is serving a Fall Supper from 4:30 to 7 p.m. The menu includes turkey & ham with all the trimmings. The cost is $8 for adults, $5 for kids and free for children under five. 
St. George Catholic Church in Hartford is serving a Fall Dinner from 11 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. In addition to the roast turkey meal, there will be a country store , raffle and game room for kids. The cost is $10 for adults, $5 for children, free for kids 5 and under. 
Find your way through 11 acres of twists and turns at the Heartland Country Corn Maze southeast of Harrisburg on Highway 11. Today's hours are from noon to 5 p.m. Admission is $7, $5 for kids, free for ages 4 and under. 
Films playing at the Wells Fargo CineDome in the Washington Pavilion include Everest, Minions, Deepsea Challenge 3D and Walking With Dinosaurs: Prehistoric Planet. 
New Hollywood releases playing at a theater near you include Gem and the Holograms, rated PG, the Last Witch Hunter, rated PG-13, Rock the Kasbah, Steve Jobs and Paranormal Activity: The Ghost Dimension, all rated R. 
After you're done raking the yard, bring your leaves to the two city drop-offs in Sioux Falls. They're located at 1015 East Chambers Street, by the Household Hazardous Waste Facility, and at 100 North Lyon Boulevard, west of the fairgrounds. Today's hours are from noon to 5 p.m. The cost is $3 a carload. 
It's a busy day on ice at the SCHEELS IcePlex. The Sioux Falls Junior Stampede hockey team takes on the Minnesota Blades at 11:15 a.m. That's followed by a family open skate from 1:30 to 3 p.m. A hockey stick-n-puck goes from 3-5 p.m. The IcePlex is located at the Sanford Sports Complex.
